LANCASTER, Pa. (WHTM) – John Burkhart, the former Officer in Charge of the Lancaster County Drug Task Force, has been charged with stealing more than $200,000 from the Task Force and depositing at least $170,000 into his personal bank account between 2015-2020.

Second, the Grand Jury found that Burkhart was allegedly solely responsible for recording and delivering cash deposits from the Drug Task Force to the county treasurer after the seized assets were forfeited by court order.

When a bank account was seized by the Drug Task Force, the procedure was for the bank to send a check to the Drug Task Force, and the check would be deposited into Lancaster County’s general fund account.
